description: Solid Joys is a daily devotional written and read by John Piper. These short and substantive readings will feed your joy in Jesus every day of the year. Discover more from Piper at desiringGod.org.

items.content: When Jesus says, “I will grant him to sit with me on my throne,” he promises us a share in the rule of all things.
items.contentSnippet: When Jesus says, “I will grant him to sit with me on my throne,” he promises us a share in the rule of all things.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Supremacy of Christ, Revelation 3:21
itunes.subtitle: When Jesus says, “I will grant him to sit with me on my throne,” he promises us a share in the rule of all things.
itunes.summary: When Jesus says, “I will grant him to sit with me on my throne,” he promises us a share in the rule of all things.

items.title: We Will Rule All Things

items.content: Jesus anchored the happiness of suffering saints in the reward of heaven. And he anchored the happiness of successful saints in the same.
items.contentSnippet: Jesus anchored the happiness of suffering saints in the reward of heaven. And he anchored the happiness of successful saints in the same.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, Heaven & Hell, Joy, Matthew 5:11
itunes.subtitle: Jesus anchored the happiness of suffering saints in the reward of heaven. And he anchored the happiness of successful saints in the same.
itunes.summary: Jesus anchored the happiness of suffering saints in the reward of heaven. And he anchored the happiness of successful saints in the same.

items.title: The Anchor of Joy

items.content: If we don’t call to mind what God has said about himself and about us, we will languish. Never forget that our God is the God of the impossible.
items.contentSnippet: If we don’t call to mind what God has said about himself and about us, we will languish. Never forget that our God is the God of the impossible.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, Sanctification & Growth, Lamentations 3:21–22
itunes.subtitle: If we don’t call to mind what God has said about himself and about us, we will languish. Never forget that our God is the God of the impossible.
itunes.summary: If we don’t call to mind what God has said about himself and about us, we will languish. Never forget that our God is the God of the impossible.

items.title: The Battle to Remind

items.content: Every little thing you do that is good is seen and valued and rewarded by the Lord. And he will pay you back for it.
items.contentSnippet: Every little thing you do that is good is seen and valued and rewarded by the Lord. And he will pay you back for it.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, Work & Vocation, Ephesians 6:7–8
itunes.subtitle: Every little thing you do that is good is seen and valued and rewarded by the Lord. And he will pay you back for it.
itunes.summary: Every little thing you do that is good is seen and valued and rewarded by the Lord. And he will pay you back for it.

items.title: How to Serve a Bad Boss

items.content: Yield to the sovereignty of God in all the details of life, and rest in his infallible promises to show himself mighty on your behalf.
items.contentSnippet: Yield to the sovereignty of God in all the details of life, and rest in his infallible promises to show himself mighty on your behalf.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, Pride & Humility, James 4:13–16
itunes.subtitle: Yield to the sovereignty of God in all the details of life, and rest in his infallible promises to show himself mighty on your behalf.
itunes.summary: Yield to the sovereignty of God in all the details of life, and rest in his infallible promises to show himself mighty on your behalf.

items.title: The Remedy for Pride

items.content: Receive Christ, welcome Christ, embrace Christ — not just as your fire insurance policy, but as your eagerly awaited Treasure and Friend and Lord.
items.contentSnippet: Receive Christ, welcome Christ, embrace Christ — not just as your fire insurance policy, but as your eagerly awaited Treasure and Friend and Lord.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, Faith, Hebrews 9:28
itunes.subtitle: Receive Christ, welcome Christ, embrace Christ — not just as your fire insurance policy, but as your eagerly awaited Treasure and Friend and Lord.
itunes.summary: Receive Christ, welcome Christ, embrace Christ — not just as your fire insurance policy, but as your eagerly awaited Treasure and Friend and Lord.

items.title: Authentic Faith Is Eager for Christ to Come

items.content: Be patient and loving as despairing people wake up from their dark night and regret their hasty words.
items.contentSnippet: Be patient and loving as despairing people wake up from their dark night and regret their hasty words.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, Wisdom, Job 6:26
itunes.subtitle: Be patient and loving as despairing people wake up from their dark night and regret their hasty words.
itunes.summary: Be patient and loving as despairing people wake up from their dark night and regret their hasty words.

items.title: Words for the Wind

items.content: What act could be more one-sidedly free and non-negotiated than one person raising another from the dead? This is the meaning of grace.
items.contentSnippet: What act could be more one-sidedly free and non-negotiated than one person raising another from the dead? This is the meaning of grace.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Grace of God, Ephesians 2:4–6
itunes.subtitle: What act could be more one-sidedly free and non-negotiated than one person raising another from the dead? This is the meaning of grace.
itunes.summary: What act could be more one-sidedly free and non-negotiated than one person raising another from the dead? This is the meaning of grace.

items.title: The Freeness of Grace

items.content: Our emotions are governed in large measure by what we consider — what we dwell on with our minds.
items.contentSnippet: Our emotions are governed in large measure by what we consider — what we dwell on with our minds.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, Life of the Mind, Hebrews 12:3
itunes.subtitle: Our emotions are governed in large measure by what we consider — what we dwell on with our minds.
itunes.summary: Our emotions are governed in large measure by what we consider — what we dwell on with our minds.

items.title: The Window of the Heart

items.content: When the command of God comes with the creating, converting power of the Holy Spirit, it gives life. And we believe and rejoice and obey.
items.contentSnippet: When the command of God comes with the creating, converting power of the Holy Spirit, it gives life. And we believe and rejoice and obey.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, Regeneration, Ephesians 5:14
itunes.subtitle: When the command of God comes with the creating, converting power of the Holy Spirit, it gives life. And we believe and rejoice and obey.
itunes.summary: When the command of God comes with the creating, converting power of the Holy Spirit, it gives life. And we believe and rejoice and obey.

items.title: The Command That Creates

items.content: Freedom from greed comes from the deeply satisfying faith in God’s future grace.
items.contentSnippet: Freedom from greed comes from the deeply satisfying faith in God’s future grace.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, Faith, Giving, 2 Corinthians 9:8
itunes.subtitle: Freedom from greed comes from the deeply satisfying faith in God’s future grace.
itunes.summary: Freedom from greed comes from the deeply satisfying faith in God’s future grace.

items.title: The Experiential Key

items.content: If God exists, then he is the measure of all things, and what he thinks about all things is the measure of what we should think.
items.contentSnippet: If God exists, then he is the measure of all things, and what he thinks about all things is the measure of what we should think.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, Truth, Romans 3:3–4
itunes.subtitle: If God exists, then he is the measure of all things, and what he thinks about all things is the measure of what we should think.
itunes.summary: If God exists, then he is the measure of all things, and what he thinks about all things is the measure of what we should think.

items.title: Passionate for God and Truth

items.content: When God judges believers in the end, he will forgive us all our sins and grant us life everlasting.
items.contentSnippet: When God judges believers in the end, he will forgive us all our sins and grant us life everlasting.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, End Times, Revelation 20:12
itunes.subtitle: When God judges believers in the end, he will forgive us all our sins and grant us life everlasting.
itunes.summary: When God judges believers in the end, he will forgive us all our sins and grant us life everlasting.

items.title: How Believers Will Be Judged

items.content: God is not the God of some grace. He is the God of all grace — including the infinite, inexhaustible stores of future grace that we need to endure to the end.
items.contentSnippet: God is not the God of some grace. He is the God of all grace — including the infinite, inexhaustible stores of future grace that we need to endure to the end.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Grace of God, 1 Peter 5:10
itunes.subtitle: God is not the God of some grace. He is the God of all grace — including the infinite, inexhaustible stores of future grace that we need to endure to the end.
itunes.summary: God is not the God of some grace. He is the God of all grace — including the infinite, inexhaustible stores of future grace that we need to endure to the end.

items.title: Only a Little While

items.content: Christ promises to work for us, and to be for us so much that, when our missionary life is over, we will not be able to say we’ve sacrificed anything.
items.contentSnippet: Christ promises to work for us, and to be for us so much that, when our missionary life is over, we will not be able to say we’ve sacrificed anything.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, Frontier Missions, Mark 10:27
itunes.subtitle: Christ promises to work for us, and to be for us so much that, when our missionary life is over, we will not be able to say we’ve sacrificed anything.
itunes.summary: Christ promises to work for us, and to be for us so much that, when our missionary life is over, we will not be able to say we’ve sacrificed anything.

items.title: Gain What You Cannot Lose

items.content: God gives both the sustaining grace we need in times of trouble, and the suffering which makes us depend on his grace.
items.contentSnippet: God gives both the sustaining grace we need in times of trouble, and the suffering which makes us depend on his grace.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Grace of God, Acts 14:22
itunes.subtitle: God gives both the sustaining grace we need in times of trouble, and the suffering which makes us depend on his grace.
itunes.summary: God gives both the sustaining grace we need in times of trouble, and the suffering which makes us depend on his grace.

items.title: Grace Denied and Supplied

items.content: This is God’s will for you and this is why Christ died: that you would draw near to God.
items.contentSnippet: This is God’s will for you and this is why Christ died: that you would draw near to God.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Gospel, Hebrews 10:22
itunes.subtitle: This is God’s will for you and this is why Christ died: that you would draw near to God.
itunes.summary: This is God’s will for you and this is why Christ died: that you would draw near to God.

items.title: God’s Will Is That You Draw Near

items.content: Satan is helpless to do the one thing he wants to do most: damn us. Christ bore our damnation.
items.contentSnippet: Satan is helpless to do the one thing he wants to do most: damn us. Christ bore our damnation.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, Death & Dying, The Power & Effects of Sin, Colossians 2:13–15
itunes.subtitle: Satan is helpless to do the one thing he wants to do most: damn us. Christ bore our damnation.
itunes.summary: Satan is helpless to do the one thing he wants to do most: damn us. Christ bore our damnation.

items.title: Our Toothless Enemy

items.content: Does your faith make you eager to forsake sin and make progress in holiness? That’s the kind of faith God requires.
items.contentSnippet: Does your faith make you eager to forsake sin and make progress in holiness? That’s the kind of faith God requires.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, Faith, Hebrews 10:14
itunes.subtitle: Does your faith make you eager to forsake sin and make progress in holiness? That’s the kind of faith God requires.
itunes.summary: Does your faith make you eager to forsake sin and make progress in holiness? That’s the kind of faith God requires.

items.title: Hope for Imperfect Christians

items.content: The strength of your faith does not uproot trees. God does. The object of your faith is more important than the quantity of your faith.
items.contentSnippet: The strength of your faith does not uproot trees. God does. The object of your faith is more important than the quantity of your faith.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, Faith, Romans 9:16
itunes.subtitle: The strength of your faith does not uproot trees. God does. The object of your faith is more important than the quantity of your faith.
itunes.summary: The strength of your faith does not uproot trees. God does. The object of your faith is more important than the quantity of your faith.

items.title: The Smallest Faith

items.content: If you are a Christian, death is no longer a punishment for sin. Your sin has been put away by the death of Christ. Christ took the punishment.
items.contentSnippet: If you are a Christian, death is no longer a punishment for sin. Your sin has been put away by the death of Christ. Christ took the punishment.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, Death & Dying, Hebrews 9:27–28
itunes.subtitle: If you are a Christian, death is no longer a punishment for sin. Your sin has been put away by the death of Christ. Christ took the punishment.
itunes.summary: If you are a Christian, death is no longer a punishment for sin. Your sin has been put away by the death of Christ. Christ took the punishment.

items.title: What Jesus Did to Death

items.content: Be thankful for the past grace from the last year, and be confident in the future grace for the new year.
items.contentSnippet: Be thankful for the past grace from the last year, and be confident in the future grace for the new year.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Grace of God, 1 Corinthians 15:10
itunes.subtitle: Be thankful for the past grace from the last year, and be confident in the future grace for the new year.
itunes.summary: Be thankful for the past grace from the last year, and be confident in the future grace for the new year.

items.title: Grace for the New Year

items.content: The lifetime of this year passes before our eyes, and we face the inevitable question: Did we live it well?
items.contentSnippet: The lifetime of this year passes before our eyes, and we face the inevitable question: Did we live it well?
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Unwasted Life, Psalm 90:5–6, Psalm 90:12
itunes.subtitle: The lifetime of this year passes before our eyes, and we face the inevitable question: Did we live it well?
itunes.summary: The lifetime of this year passes before our eyes, and we face the inevitable question: Did we live it well?

items.title: Death Rehearsal

items.content: When God works in our hearts by the blood of Christ, we feel and think and act in ways more pleasing to him.
items.contentSnippet: When God works in our hearts by the blood of Christ, we feel and think and act in ways more pleasing to him.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Grace of God, Hebrews 13:20–21
itunes.subtitle: When God works in our hearts by the blood of Christ, we feel and think and act in ways more pleasing to him.
itunes.summary: When God works in our hearts by the blood of Christ, we feel and think and act in ways more pleasing to him.

items.title: Outfitted and Empowered

items.content: Flee from the wrath of God, tremble with joy that you are saved, and rescue others along the way.
items.contentSnippet: Flee from the wrath of God, tremble with joy that you are saved, and rescue others along the way.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Wrath of God, 1 Thessalonians 1:10
itunes.subtitle: Flee from the wrath of God, tremble with joy that you are saved, and rescue others along the way.
itunes.summary: Flee from the wrath of God, tremble with joy that you are saved, and rescue others along the way.

items.title: A Horrible Destiny

items.content: Study the glory of God. Treasure it in all things and above all things. Then study your soul. Know why you treasure glories that are not God’s glory.
items.contentSnippet: Study the glory of God. Treasure it in all things and above all things. Then study your soul. Know why you treasure glories that are not God’s glory.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Glory of God, Romans 5:2
itunes.subtitle: Study the glory of God. Treasure it in all things and above all things. Then study your soul. Know why you treasure glories that are not God’s glory.
itunes.summary: Study the glory of God. Treasure it in all things and above all things. Then study your soul. Know why you treasure glories that are not God’s glory.

items.title: Glory Is the Goal

items.content: God did not create humans in his image to be aimless, like lifeless leaves blown around in the backyard of life. He created us to be purposeful.
items.contentSnippet: God did not create humans in his image to be aimless, like lifeless leaves blown around in the backyard of life. He created us to be purposeful.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Unwasted Life, Hebrews 10:24
itunes.subtitle: God did not create humans in his image to be aimless, like lifeless leaves blown around in the backyard of life. He created us to be purposeful.
itunes.summary: God did not create humans in his image to be aimless, like lifeless leaves blown around in the backyard of life. He created us to be purposeful.

items.title: What Is Your Aim?

items.content: Christ’s death was judgment on him because he bore our sins (not his own), and it was mercy toward us who trust him.
items.contentSnippet: Christ’s death was judgment on him because he bore our sins (not his own), and it was mercy toward us who trust him.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, Suffering, 2 Samuel 22:31, 2 Samuel 22:5
itunes.subtitle: Christ’s death was judgment on him because he bore our sins (not his own), and it was mercy toward us who trust him.
itunes.summary: Christ’s death was judgment on him because he bore our sins (not his own), and it was mercy toward us who trust him.

items.title: How to Contemplate Calamity

items.content: Jesus offers you a clear purpose for living, hope that your failures will be forgiven, and help in your fight against sin.
items.contentSnippet: Jesus offers you a clear purpose for living, hope that your failures will be forgiven, and help in your fight against sin.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Birth of Christ, 1 John 3:7–8
itunes.subtitle: Christmas Day
itunes.summary: Jesus offers you a clear purpose for living, hope that your failures will be forgiven, and help in your fight against sin.

items.title: Three Christmas Presents

items.content: Jesus appeared in the world for two reasons: to help us stop sinning, and to satisfy God’s anger when we do sin.
items.contentSnippet: Jesus appeared in the world for two reasons: to help us stop sinning, and to satisfy God’s anger when we do sin.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Birth of Christ, 1 John 3:7–8
itunes.subtitle: Advent  |  Day 24
itunes.summary: Jesus appeared in the world for two reasons: to help us stop sinning, and to satisfy God’s anger when we do sin.

items.title: Two Purposes for Christmas

items.content: Look to Jesus this Christmas. Receive the reconciliation that he purchased. Don’t put the gift on the shelf unopened.
items.contentSnippet: Look to Jesus this Christmas. Receive the reconciliation that he purchased. Don’t put the gift on the shelf unopened.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Birth of Christ, Romans 5:10–11
itunes.subtitle: Advent  |  Day 23
itunes.summary: Look to Jesus this Christmas. Receive the reconciliation that he purchased. Don’t put the gift on the shelf unopened.

items.title: God’s Indescribable Gift

items.content: The whole Bible is written that you might be awakened to the wonder that Jesus Christ is the Son of God who came into the world.
items.contentSnippet: The whole Bible is written that you might be awakened to the wonder that Jesus Christ is the Son of God who came into the world.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Birth of Christ, John 20:30–31
itunes.subtitle: Advent  |  Day 22
itunes.summary: The whole Bible is written that you might be awakened to the wonder that Jesus Christ is the Son of God who came into the world.

items.title: That You May Believe

items.content: Jesus’s birth was not a coming into being of a new person, but a coming into the world of an infinitely old person.
items.contentSnippet: Jesus’s birth was not a coming into being of a new person, but a coming into the world of an infinitely old person.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Birth of Christ, John 18:37
itunes.subtitle: Advent  |  Day 21
itunes.summary: Jesus’s birth was not a coming into being of a new person, but a coming into the world of an infinitely old person.

items.title: The Birth of the Ancient of Days

items.content: If you want to give a gift to God this Christmas, walk off the assembly line of sin and don’t go back. Take up your place, instead, in the picket line of love.
items.contentSnippet: If you want to give a gift to God this Christmas, walk off the assembly line of sin and don’t go back. Take up your place, instead, in the picket line of love.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Birth of Christ, 1 John 3:8
itunes.subtitle: Advent  |  Day 20
itunes.summary: If you want to give a gift to God this Christmas, walk off the assembly line of sin and don’t go back. Take up your place, instead, in the picket line of love.

items.title: Christmas Solidarity

items.content: Forgiven, we are indestructible. Satan’s plan was to condemn God’s followers in God’s own courtroom. But now, in Christ, there is no condemnation.
items.contentSnippet: Forgiven, we are indestructible. Satan’s plan was to condemn God’s followers in God’s own courtroom. But now, in Christ, there is no condemnation.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Birth of Christ, Hebrews 2:14–15
itunes.subtitle: Advent  |  Day 19
itunes.summary: Forgiven, we are indestructible. Satan’s plan was to condemn God’s followers in God’s own courtroom. But now, in Christ, there is no condemnation.

items.title: Christmas Is for Freedom

items.content: Distrust God’s mercy, and all is lost. But conquer here, and nothing can harm you for a million ages.
items.contentSnippet: Distrust God’s mercy, and all is lost. But conquer here, and nothing can harm you for a million ages.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Birth of Christ, World Missions, John 17:18
itunes.subtitle: Advent  |  Day 18
itunes.summary: Distrust God’s mercy, and all is lost. But conquer here, and nothing can harm you for a million ages.

items.title: The Christmas Model for Missions

items.content: God put our sins on his Son and judged them there, so that he could put them out of his mind, and deal with us mercifully and remain just.
items.contentSnippet: God put our sins on his Son and judged them there, so that he could put them out of his mind, and deal with us mercifully and remain just.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Birth of Christ, Salvation, Jeremiah 31:31
itunes.subtitle: Advent  |  Day 17
itunes.summary: God put our sins on his Son and judged them there, so that he could put them out of his mind, and deal with us mercifully and remain just.

items.title: The Greatest Salvation Imaginable

items.content: God delights to show his power through apparent defeat. He sometimes retreats in order to win strategic victories.
items.contentSnippet: God delights to show his power through apparent defeat. He sometimes retreats in order to win strategic victories.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Birth of Christ, Philippians 2:9–11
itunes.subtitle: Advent  |  Day 16
itunes.summary: God delights to show his power through apparent defeat. He sometimes retreats in order to win strategic victories.

items.title: God’s Most Successful Setback

items.content: Jesus came that we might have Life, now and forever. Make your Now the richer and deeper this Christmas by drinking at the fountain of Forever. It is so near.
items.contentSnippet: Jesus came that we might have Life, now and forever. Make your Now the richer and deeper this Christmas by drinking at the fountain of Forever. It is so near.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, Hope, The Birth of Christ, John 10:10
itunes.subtitle: Advent  |  Day 15
itunes.summary: Jesus came that we might have Life, now and forever. Make your Now the richer and deeper this Christmas by drinking at the fountain of Forever. It is so near.

items.title: Life and Death at Christmas

items.content: The meaning of Christmas is that God takes salvation, puts it in your heart, and seals you as his child.
items.contentSnippet: The meaning of Christmas is that God takes salvation, puts it in your heart, and seals you as his child.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Birth of Christ, Salvation, Hebrews 8:6
itunes.subtitle: Advent  |  Day 14
itunes.summary: The meaning of Christmas is that God takes salvation, puts it in your heart, and seals you as his child.

items.title: Making It Real for His People

items.content: Our High Priest is seated at the right hand of the Majesty in heaven. No Old Testament priest could ever say that.
items.contentSnippet: Our High Priest is seated at the right hand of the Majesty in heaven. No Old Testament priest could ever say that.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Birth of Christ, The Person of Christ, Hebrews 8:1–2
itunes.subtitle: Advent  |  Day 13
itunes.summary: Our High Priest is seated at the right hand of the Majesty in heaven. No Old Testament priest could ever say that.

items.title: The Final Reality Is Here

items.content: Jesus came to orient all our attention on himself, ministering for us first on Calvary as our final Sacrifice and then in heaven as our final Priest.
items.contentSnippet: Jesus came to orient all our attention on himself, ministering for us first on Calvary as our final Sacrifice and then in heaven as our final Priest.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Birth of Christ, The Person of Christ, Hebrews 8:1–2
itunes.subtitle: Advent  |  Day 12
itunes.summary: Jesus came to orient all our attention on himself, ministering for us first on Calvary as our final Sacrifice and then in heaven as our final Priest.

items.title: Replacing the Shadows

items.content: In dying, Christ de-fanged the devil. How? By covering all our sin. This means that Satan has no legitimate grounds to accuse us before God.
items.contentSnippet: In dying, Christ de-fanged the devil. How? By covering all our sin. This means that Satan has no legitimate grounds to accuse us before God.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Birth of Christ, The Death of Christ, Hebrews 2:14–15
itunes.subtitle: Advent  |  Day 11
itunes.summary: In dying, Christ de-fanged the devil. How? By covering all our sin. This means that Satan has no legitimate grounds to accuse us before God.

items.title: Why Jesus Came

items.content: Giving gifts to Christ is like fasting — going without something to show that Christ is more valuable than what you are going without.
items.contentSnippet: Giving gifts to Christ is like fasting — going without something to show that Christ is more valuable than what you are going without.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Birth of Christ, Giving, Matthew 2:10–11
itunes.subtitle: Advent  |  Day 10
itunes.summary: Giving gifts to Christ is like fasting — going without something to show that Christ is more valuable than what you are going without.

items.title: Gold, Frankincense, and Myrrh

items.content: Let this Christmas be the time when you ponder what it means — what it costs — to worship and follow Jesus, the Messiah.
items.contentSnippet: Let this Christmas be the time when you ponder what it means — what it costs — to worship and follow Jesus, the Messiah.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Birth of Christ, The Person of Christ, Matthew 2:3
itunes.subtitle: Advent  |  Day 9
itunes.summary: Let this Christmas be the time when you ponder what it means — what it costs — to worship and follow Jesus, the Messiah.

items.title: Two Kinds of Opposition to Jesus

items.content: God influenced the stars in the sky to get a little handful of foreign magi to Bethlehem so that they would worship his Son.
items.contentSnippet: God influenced the stars in the sky to get a little handful of foreign magi to Bethlehem so that they would worship his Son.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Birth of Christ, Life of Worship, Matthew 2:2
itunes.subtitle: Advent  |  Day 8
itunes.summary: God influenced the stars in the sky to get a little handful of foreign magi to Bethlehem so that they would worship his Son.

items.title: Bethlehem’s Supernatural Star

items.content: Christmas proves how Jesus is Messiah — a King, and Promise-Fulfiller — for all the nations, not just Israel.
items.contentSnippet: Christmas proves how Jesus is Messiah — a King, and Promise-Fulfiller — for all the nations, not just Israel.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper

itunes.subtitle: Advent  |  Day 7
itunes.summary: Christmas proves how Jesus is Messiah — a King, and Promise-Fulfiller — for all the nations, not just Israel.

items.title: Messiah for the Magi

items.content: The key that unlocks the treasure chest of God’s peace is faith in the promises of God.
items.contentSnippet: The key that unlocks the treasure chest of God’s peace is faith in the promises of God.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Birth of Christ, Luke 2:12–14
itunes.subtitle: Advent  |  Day 6
itunes.summary: The key that unlocks the treasure chest of God’s peace is faith in the promises of God.

items.title: Peace to Those with Whom He Is Pleased

items.content: God could have seen to it that Jesus have a room at his birth. But that would have been a detour off the Calvary road.
items.contentSnippet: God could have seen to it that Jesus have a room at his birth. But that would have been a detour off the Calvary road.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

itunes.author: John Piper
itunes.keywords: Desiring God, John Piper, Article, The Birth of Christ, Luke 2:6–7
itunes.subtitle: Advent  |  Day 5
itunes.summary: God could have seen to it that Jesus have a room at his birth. But that would have been a detour off the Calvary road.

items.title: No Detour from Calvary

items.content: Do not think, because you experience adversity, that the hand of the Lord is shortened.
items.contentSnippet: Do not think, because you experience adversity, that the hand of the Lord is shortened.
items.creator: John Piper
items.dc:creator: John Piper

items.title: For God’s Little People

itunes.author: Desiring God
itunes.summary: Solid Joys is a daily devotional written and read by John Piper. These short and substantive readings will feed your joy in Jesus every day of the year. Discover more from Piper at desiringGod.org.

title: Solid Joys Daily Devotional
